intro: Pycnostachys mildbraedii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pycnostachys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorls and are often pale green or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
